meanings.definition: The outermost layer of the skin.
meanings.sent1: The epiderm protects our body from germs and sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She applied sunscreen to her epiderm before going to the beach.
meanings.sent3: The epiderm decided to throw a party for the dermis and hypodermis.
meanings.sent4: Her epiderm felt like a shield against the harsh elements of the environment.
meanings.sent5: The epiderm, like a brave soldier, stood guard over the body.

meanings.definition: A thin layer of cells that covers the surface of plants.
meanings.sent1: The epiderm of the leaf helps in preventing water loss.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners study the epiderm of plants to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The epiderm of the plant blushed when praised for its beauty.
meanings.sent4: The epiderm of the stem acts as a protective barrier for the plant.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the epiderm of the leaf looked like a delicate lace.
